title: 106_s1805
content: The "Hunger Relief Act of 1999" restores food stamp benefits for aliens. Limited eligibility of qualified aliens for certain federal programs under the Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act of 1996 is amended to specify restrictions on benefits. The Limited eligibility of qualified aliens for certain federal programs under the Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act of 1996 is amended to specify restrictions on benefits, including redesignating subclauses and clauses and making adjustments to the language used. The Limited eligibility of qualified aliens for certain federal programs under the Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act of 1996 is amended to specify restrictions on benefits, including redesignating subclauses and clauses and making adjustments to the language used in subparagraphs. The Limited eligibility of qualified aliens for certain federal programs under the Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act of 1996 is amended to specify restrictions on benefits, including redesignating subclauses and clauses and making adjustments to the language used in subparagraphs by striking certain phrases and inserting new language. The Limited eligibility of qualified aliens for federal programs is amended to restrict benefits under the Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act of 1996 by making changes to language and specifying limitations on certain benefits. The Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act of 1996 is amended to restrict benefits for qualified aliens by specifying limitations on certain programs and adding requirements for sponsor's affidavit of support. The Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act of 1996 is amended to restrict benefits for qualified aliens by specifying limitations on certain programs and adding requirements for sponsor's affidavit of support. Additionally, benefits under the Food Stamp Act of 1977 may be provided if a sponsor experiences hardship or severe circumstances beyond their control, as determined by the Secretary of Agriculture. The Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act of 1996 is amended to restrict benefits for qualified aliens under the Food Stamp Act of 1977 for specific time periods. The Vehicle Allowance is addressed in Section 3. Section 5(g)(2) of the Food Stamp Act of 1977 is amended to include an alternative vehicle allowance if the fair market value of the vehicle exceeds $4,650. This amendment provides additional standards for determining eligibility for assistance under the State program funded under part A of title IV of the Social Security Act. The amendments made by this section of the Social Security Act will result in lower attribution of resources to certain households. State agencies can choose to apply State vehicle allowance standards to all households with lower resource attribution. The effective date for these amendments is July 1, 2000. The maximum amount of excess shelter expense deduction is specified in Section 4. Section 5(e)(7)(B) of the Food Stamp Act of 1977 is amended to adjust the monthly amounts for fiscal years 1999 to 2002 and subsequent years. The monthly amounts for fiscal years 1999 to 2002 and subsequent years will be adjusted based on the Consumer Price Index for All Urban Consumers. Authorization of $20,000,000 annually for fiscal years 2001 through 2005 to purchase additional commodities for the Emergency Food Assistance Program, with at least 15% allocated for direct expenses incurred by emergency feeding organizations.
